dct_title_s: Historic Urban Growth Racine County, Wisconsin 2004
dct_description_sm: This polygon data layer represents the historic urban growth inventory for RacineCounty, Wisconsin in 2004. This data set was originally published by the Southeast Wisconsin Regional Planning Commission (SEWRPC) on August 26, 2004.[This data set contains polygon features showing the growth of urban areas in the seven-county Southeastern Wisconsin Region. The polygon features were digitized from delineations prepared from aerial photographs, historical maps and records, and other reference materials. The data set contains the approximated boundaries of urbanized development for selected years from 1850 to 1995. The historic urban growth polygons are identified according to year of urban development.]
dct_creator_sm: Southeast Wisconsin Regional Planning Commission-Land Use Division and GIS Division
schema_provider_s: American Geographical Society Library â€“ UWM Libraries
dct_rights_sm: Please see the UWM Libraries statement on Copyright and Digital Collections.[There are no legal prerequisites for accessing this data set. Potential users should contact the Southeastern Wisconsin Regional Planning Commission GIS Division.][This data set was prepared from historical hardcopy maps, aerial photographs, and and other source materials. The boundary lines of urban development are approximated and may not accurately reflect the actual urban development for each year of growth.]
